H0.text: Dead organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

H1.text: Inorganic material is what most fungi get organic compounds from.

H2.text: Living organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

H3.text: Carnivorous organisms are the source from which most fungi obtain organic compounds.

A4.text: Saprotrophic nutrition is a process of chemoheterotrophic extracellular digestion involved in the processing of decayed (dead or waste) organic matter.

A5.text: Cellulose, a major portion of plant cells, and therefore a major constituent of decaying matter is broken down into glucose
